metadata.title: CVE-2012-1164 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
slapd in OpenLDAP before 2.4.30 allows remote attackers to cause a denialof service (assertion failure and daemon exit) via an LDAP search querywith attrsOnly set to true, which causes empty attributes to be returned.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-1164` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ldap-utils - 2.4.31-1ubuntu2
libldap-2.4-2 - 2.4.31-1ubuntu2
slapd - 2.4.31-1ubuntu2
slapd-smbk5pwd - 2.4.31-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openldap package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.31-1ubuntu2').
